questions.question: Which of these is NOT located in China?

choices.answer: the Nile River
the North China Plain
the Huang River
Guangxi Zhungzu

questions.question: Why does the Huang River have a distinctive yellow color?

choices.answer: Yellow flowers grow along its banks.
Yellow silt from the nearby desert is in the water.
It reflects the yellow light of the sun.
It is polluted from all the factories in China.

questions.question: Why did Shi Huangdi build the Great Wall of China?

choices.answer: to help his empire get along better with neighboring peoples
to control flooding along the northern border
to help with irrigation and canal building
to protect the empire from northern invaders

questions.question: Three of these were achievements of the Han dynasty. Which was NOT?

choices.answer: New states were formed in order to centralize the gov't.
The building of new roads improved transportation.
Government officials had to take civil service exams.
The first complete history of China was written.

questions.question: Which of these helped unite Chinese culture during the Han dynasty?

choices.answer: a network of roads connecting China to the rest of the world
advancements in trade and transportation
a new system of religion
the elimination of middlemen

questions.question: Three of these were invented during the Han dynasty. Which was NOT?

choices.answer: silk
porcelain
paper
ink

questions.question: How did Confucianism and Taoism influence Chinese history and culture?

choices.answer: People became greedy and cruel towards others.
More people were allowed to go to school.
Values such as order and harmony began to spread.
People of nobility became educated as scholars.

questions.question: What might be considered the first principle of Confucianism?

choices.answer: Treat people the way you want to be treated.
Be selfish and only take care of yourself.
It doesn't matter how other people think of you.
Read as many books as you can.

questions.question: Three of these describe The Analects. Which does NOT?

choices.answer: a collection of sayings by Confucius
advice to people who want to do the right thing
one of many printed works by Confucius
the main printed work regarding Confucius

questions.question: What have people built to control flooding along the Huang River?

choices.answer: terraces
sinkholes
levees
water rides

questions.question: Why has the Huang River been called "China's Sorrow"?

choices.answer: The river water is bluish - the same color as tears.
Flooding has wiped out crops and left people homeless.
It embarrasses the Chinese that their river is so polluted.
Invaders used the river to get to China and take over.

questions.question: Which is the best description of the Tibetan Plateau?

choices.answer: The limestone of the plateau has eroded into cool shapes.
The warm waters of the Gulf of Tonkin wash upon its shore.
The land is very rocky and is surrounded by mountain ranges.
The plateau is the center of Chinese agriculture & industry.

questions.question: Three of these landforms are found in China. Which is NOT?

choices.answer: plains
mountains
deserts
badlands

questions.question: Which of these was an important product of the Zhou Dynasty?

choices.answer: electronic equipment
pottery
silk
gold

questions.question: Three of these were inventions made to improve daily life in China. Which was NOT?

choices.answer: projects to control flooding
huge walls built around towns
iron used to make farm tools and weapons
a new system of money

questions.question: How did the Bronze Age get its name?

choices.answer: Lots of people used self-tanner (bronzer).
People made their tools out of bronze.
There was a lot of bronze jewelry.
Bronze was a main trade good on the Silk Road.

questions.question: Why was the second part of the Zhou Dynasty referred to as the Golden Age of China?

choices.answer: The Chinese traded a LOT of gold on the Silk Road.
Gold was the main type of metal in their jewelry.
This is when the Golden Retriever was bred.
This means it was a time of many achievements & prosperity.

questions.question: Which Chinese dynasty was the most important and WHY?

choices.answer: Zhou
Han
Qin
Shang

questions.question: Children should honor and respect their parents. Who is most likely to have said this?

choices.answer: Han Gaozu
Laozi
Confucius
Shi Huangdi
